text:
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Releases-and-Updates/Sunset-Adding-non-user-emails-to-form-submissions-email/ba-p/629372>
Can anyone confirm that the email notifications will have stopped working to external emails unless they're added as a user in HubSpot ?
What I did is to take that whole block out and overrwrite it with my own CSS rules. But it's maybe not what you want. I did that for a customer template where the font is anyway given.

unfortunately I don’t think this is possible. It’s really tough for us, too. That’s why the HubSpot KB just gives the bulleted

• Go to *Settings* :gear: 
• Click on *Users & Teams*
etc
Is there a way to display the members of an active list on a HubSpot CMS page ? I have a client that wants to print out a membership directory on a CMS page. I didn't know if this was doable?

Hi Tricia, you would need to add CSS to your child.css file in the child theme to overwrite the code for the primary font. It won't ever show in this dropdown, but it will on your website. If you're not the developer of the theme, I suggest reaching out to them for help as they've likely done this before.

I received an email to my test account that said that I had a form that included a recipient who was not in my portal and they would no longer receive notifications. I can try to find the email if it's helpful, I'm sure I deleted it
I just saw the impact awards post. How do we submit case studies for the awards?
Oh, right, this is the slack for developers
Typography change in the HS Docs?
Yes it’s possible but the list has to be within a membership protected page.
Did this ever get done to where the brand kit colors are accessible in a custom module? And if your portal has multiple brand kits, how does it know which one to use?
Yeah that is fine <@U7SL518D6>
how would I go about doing that ??
it would be on a membership page ---
is there like a help article for that <@U7SL518D6>

There isn’t a direct tutorial for the specific use case. But contacts are a CRM object, so you use the CRM object functions.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/crm-objects>

Alternatively if you’re in the graphQL beta, you can also use graphQL to get the data.
ok I'm not in the beta
thanks <@U7SL518D6>
Do you use Starter of Enterprise?
<@U033VNNBBBP> We are using a Marketing Professional account.
<https://www.HubSpot.com/impact-awards>
Just found it too! :slightly_smiling_face:
Thanks Amber!

you bet! I’m surprised they’re all website case study pages since the submission info is:
• Submissions must be submitted as a blog post (1,000 words or less) or video clip (five minutes or less), and received by 11:59 PM EST on the day of the deadline.
not sure if you get told you’re winning and then you whip up a case study page, or if this is what they submitted?
<@U6W3H6YN8> <@U7SL518D6> Hubdb import tool is broken. None of the dropdowns are working. <https://sg.d.pr/wqkPtI|Video here>
Sorry, this will be fixed in a second
Thanks for reporting
No worries!
Should be fixed now if you refresh
Looks good!
